## Water quality

Water quality is a key feature for biodiversity and human-well being in the HJBL. To assess water quality in that vast region, partners must use a combination of remote sensing techniques to evaluate various parameters such as suspended sediments (turbidity), chlorophyll, and temperature ([Ritchie et al. 2003](https://www.asprs.org/wp-content/uploads/pers/2003journal/june/2003_jun_695-704.pdf),[Loaiza et al. 2023](https://www.mdpi.com/2073-4441/15/14/2606), [Lehmann et al. 2023](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41597-023-01973-y), [Macleod et al. 2016](https://www.jlimnol.it/index.php/jlimnol/article/view/jlimnol.2016.1553/1292)); and field hydrobiological surveys.
